name: Faith Cisneros
shortbio: An Undergraduate at Arizona State University majoring in Biology and Society as well as Politics and the Economy.
bio: I am a student with an interest and fascination in science communication and political applications of science. I have intermediate programming skills from working with robotics using Java and from using R as a bioinformatics intern for The Translational Genomics Research Institute’s Integrative Cancer Genomic Division. As a JEDI Scholar at the ASU Biocollections Center, my foot has been dipped into biodiversity through some exposure to entomology, botany, and vertebrates. In my free time my favorite things to do aside from spending time with loved ones are reading and writing poetry and prose. Longboarding, skateboarding, and jogging are also preferred pastimes for me when I’m itching to go outside.

name: Mary Haddad
bio: I was a German-born naturalist and scientific illustrator, a descendant of the Frankfurt branch of the Swiss Merian family, and one of the first early European naturalists to observe insects directly.

name: Savage Cree Hess
shortbio: Molecular Biology student at ASU and tabletop game designer.
bio: Savage Cree Hess is a Cree, Blackfoot, and Norwegian student at ASU studying molecular biology. He’s involved in research searching for novel viruses in urban coyote populations. He hopes to continue his work in the field and the lab and bring a better understanding to the unseen world. Outside of work, he designs tabletop games and writes short horror stories.

name: Marcus Reid
shortbio: Majoring in Health Science. Next Generation Service Corps. Minor Biological Sciences. Plants, Hikes, Ecology and Hockey
bio: I was a German polymath, geographer, naturalist, explorer, and proponent of Romantic philosophy and science. My work on botanical geography laid the foundation for the field of biogeography, and my advocacy of long-term systematic geophysical measurement laid the foundation for modern geomagnetic and meteorological monitoring.
